article.title: Search for Supersymmetry in final states with missing transverse momentum and multiple $b$-jets in proton--proton collisions at $\sqrt s = 13$ TeV with the ATLAS detector

multiple_choice_question.text: What decay topologies are shown in Figure 1?
choices: (a) Gluino decay via top squarks and (b) Gluino decay via bottom squarks.
(a) Gluino pair production and (b) Neutralino decay.

multiple_choice_question.text: What additional decay topologies does Figure 2 illustrate in the variable gluino branching ratio model?
choices: Decay topologies involving only off-shell top squark decays.
Decay topologies featuring the decay of the lightest chargino (χ˜±1).
Decay topologies where only one gluino decays via a third-generation squark.
Decay topologies where the mass difference between χ˜±1 and χ˜01 is fixed to 5 GeV.

multiple_choice_question.text: The effective mass variable (meff) is calculated as the sum of:
choices: Transverse momenta of all selected jets and leptons.
Transverse momenta of selected jets and leptons, plus the missing transverse momentum.
Missing transverse momentum and the invariant mass of the leading lepton.
Total jet mass and the missing transverse momentum.

multiple_choice_question.text: In regions with at least one selected lepton, the transverse mass (mT) is calculated using:
choices: The missing transverse momentum and the azimuthal angle between the missing transverse momentum and the leading lepton.
The transverse momenta of the three leading b-tagged jets and the missing transverse momentum.
The transverse momentum of the leading lepton and the azimuthal angle between the missing transverse momentum and the leading lepton.
The effective mass and the missing transverse momentum.
